sentence.Network_en: Did I ever tell you it took me two years to decide to become a Mormon?
sentence.Network_cn: 我告诉过你我用了两年才决定要做一个摩门教徒 么 ?

sentence.Network_en: I don't ever remember seeing a Mormon not once, not ever.
sentence.Network_cn: 我记得从来没有见过一个摩门教徒,一次也没有.

sentence.Network_en: I also greatly appreciated my Mormon Uncle and his family.
sentence.Network_cn: 我也非常感谢身为摩门教徒的叔叔和他的家人.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 摩门教（mormon）(MORMON)，即耶稣基督后期圣徒教会，简称后期圣徒，成立于1830年4月6日，由当时24岁的约瑟·史密斯在美国纽约州组建 …
它甚至宣称“自摩门教徒（MORMONS）受打击以来，还没有哪一个宗教组织受到过如此的迫害”。[11]
基督教的摩门教派（MORMONS）的情形更是众所周知的。因此，亚非地区的许多主教们都认为，宁可同意一夫多妻的作法，也不希 …

entry.tran: (约瑟夫·史密斯在美国创立的)摩门教的
entry.def: Mormon means relating to the religion started by Joseph Smith in the United States.

means.word_mean: 1. the ancient prophet whose writings were revealed to Joseph Smith who founded the Mormon Church
2. a member of the Mormon Church
1. of or pertaining to or characteristic of the Mormon church;
